intro: Adenoropium gossypiifolium, commonly known as the cottonleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are broad and often resemble cotton fibers, giving it its common name. It thrives in humid, sunny environments and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils.
